Russian agency says video shows Ukrainian soldiers boarding plane before crashRussia's Investigative Committee on Friday posted online a video of what it described as Ukrainian prisoners of war boarding a plane that later crashed in the south of the country. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 20:50:40 GMT 2EBYD53ZDZNILNJDWXF472HFXQ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russian-agency-says-video-shows-ukrainian-soldiers-boarding-plane-before-crash-2024-01-26/Reuters世界欧洲
Trudeau aide: India is cooperating with Canada amid tensions over murdered SikhIndia is cooperating with Canada amid tensions over the case of a Sikh separatist leader who was murdered in British Columbia last June, a senior government official told CTV in an interview published on Friday. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 20:06:36 GMT UUVX5EEOGRL6RJDFM2UJT4RSG4 https://www.reuters.com/world/trudeau-aide-india-is-cooperating-with-canada-amid-tensions-over-murdered-sikh-2024-01-26/Reuters世界
Cuba counts on Russians to boost still-ailing tourism sector in 2024Cuba is counting on winter-weary Russians to help boost the Caribbean island nation's ailing tourism sector in 2024, according to the Cuban ambassador in Moscow, after a disappointing 2023 saw visitors numbers fall short of the government's goals. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 20:04:19 GMT 2ZCR5OY3P5PNFHRFQKI22SXPEE https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/cuba-counts- Russian-boost-still-ailing-tourism-sector-2024-2024-01-26/Reuters世界美洲
Yemen's Houthis say they targeted oil tanker Marlin Luanda in Gulf of AdenYemen's Houthis said on Friday their naval forces carried out an operation targeting "the British oil tanker Marlin Luanda" in the Gulf of Aden causing a fire to break out. Argentina's President Milei to visit Israel in display of supportArgentina's President Javier Milei said on Friday he would travel to Israel in the "coming weeks," one of his first overseas trips since the libertarian economist took office last month after pledging strong support for Israel during his campaign. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 18:52:40 GMT EEBVEJNU3ZMETLI3LTQABIWAII https://www.reuters.com/world/argentina-president-milei-visits-israel-display-support-2024-01-26/Candelaria Grimberg世界
Ecuador top court blocks nine questions for referendumEcuador's top court has blocked nine questions that President Daniel Noboa wanted to put to Ecuadoreans in a referendum on security issues, arguing they failed to meet constitutional requirements, it said on Friday. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 18:49:50 GMT UY7KNXCHNVMYDMNJS3NNLLWHDU https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/ecuador-top-court-blocks-nine-questions-referendum-2024-01-26/Alexandra Valencia世界美洲
EU Council boss Michel drops parliament run after criticismCharles Michel, the president of the council of European Union leaders, on Friday abandoned a run for a seat in the European Parliament in the face of criticism that the move would have undermined his current role at a crucial time. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 18:42:34 GMT XPLW4ZULMVLLJCZWCD7DGHRARE https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/eu-council-president-michel-drops-plan-run-european-parliament-election-2024-01-26/Andrew Gray世界欧洲
German state broadcaster urges Israel to let 2 workers leave GazaGerman state broadcaster ARD on Friday said Israel was blocking two of its long-term Palestinian workers from leaving Gaza, where they fear for their lives, citing security concerns the broadcaster said did not make sense. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 18:33:26 GMT DBYMJVY64ZKY3J4TX4HKKQBPHY https://www.reuters.com/world/german-state-broadcaster-urges-israel-to-let-2-workers-leave-gaza-2024-01-26/Reuters世界
France confirms interest in building nuclear plant in PolandFrance has confirmed its interest in participating in Poland's nuclear energy programme and building the country's planned second nuclear power plant, the Polish climate ministry said on Friday after a meeting of top government officials. Fri, 26 Jan 2024 18:14:34 GMT RCAMY7MJDFLLVOTMKBLNXZXW6U https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/france-confirms-interest-building-nuclear-plant-poland-2024-01-26/Reuters世界欧洲
Colombia human rights ombudsman urges action to prevent firesColombia's human rights ombudsman on Friday urged local authorities of high-risk areas where fires have not occurred to take preventative action, as 34 blazes continued to burn throughout the Andean country. ICJ ruling: Key takeaways from the court decision in Israel genocide caseThe International Court of Justice (ICJ) ordered Israel on Friday to take action to prevent acts of genocide as it wages war against Hamas militants in the Gaza Strip but stopped short of calling for an immediate ceasefire.
